RequiredArguments.title: Required Arguments
RequiredArguments.description: There are four required arguments to make a valid Renew configuration.

UptimeThreshold.title: Uptime Threshold
UptimeThreshold.description: How many days uptime do you want before Renew begins to take action?

NotificationThreshold.title: Notification Threshold
NotificationThreshold.description: How many notifications before changing to Normal Mode?

DeferralDuration.title: Deferral Duration
DeferralDuration.description: How many hours is a deferral?

OptionalArguments.title: Optional Arguments
OptionalArguments.description: There are a number of optional arguments to change Renew to look and act how you want.

AggroMessage.title: Aggressive Message
AggroMessage.description: The message body you want in your Aggressive Mode dialog windows. SwiftDialog option: --message

NormalMessage.title: Normal Message
NormalMessage.description: The message body you want in your Normal Mode dialog windows. SwiftDialog option: --message

NotificationMessage.title: Notification Message
NotificationMessage.description: The message body you want in your Notification Center alerts. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --message

DeferralButtonText.title: Deferral Button Text
DeferralButtonText.description: What do you want your deferral button to say? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --button1text

NoDeferralsRemainingButtonText.title: "No Deferrals Remaining" Button Text
NoDeferralsRemainingButtonText.description: >What do you want your deferral button to say when it's greyed out in Aggressive Mode? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --button1text

RestartButtonText.title: Restart Button Text
RestartButtonText.description: What do you want your "Restart Now" button to say? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --infobuttontext

ShowDeferralCount.title: Show Deferral Count
ShowDeferralCount.description: If true, an additional sentence is added to your Normal Mode dialog windows indicating how many deferrals the user has remaining. Omit this key if you don't want the extra information.

NotificationIcon.title: Notification Icon
NotificationIcon.description: This is the icon included on the right side of the Dialog Notification. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

NotificationIconDarkMode.title: Notification Icon DarkMode
NotificationIconDarkMode.description: This is the icon included on the right side of the Dialog Notification. Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode icons. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

MessageIcon.title: Message Icon
MessageIcon.description: The icon used in your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialogs. Use "none" to disable.  Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

MessageIconDarkMode.title: Message Icon Dark Mode
MessageIconDarkMode.description: The icon used in your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialogs. Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode icons. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

BannerImage.title: Banner Image
BannerImage.description: Use this key to designate a Banner Image for your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialog windows. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --bannerimage

BannerImageDarkMode.title: Banner Image Dark Mode
BannerImageDarkMode.description: Use this key to designate a Banner Image for your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialog windows.  Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode banners. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --bannerimage

AdditionalDialogOptions.title: Additional Dialog Options
AdditionalDialogOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for all dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for what you can do.

AdditionalAggressiveOptions.title: Additional Aggressive Mode Options
AdditionalAggressiveOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Aggressive Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for what you can do.

AdditionalNormalOptions.title: Additional Normal Options
AdditionalNormalOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Normal Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for what you can do.

AdditionalNotificationOptions.title: Additional Notification Options
AdditionalNotificationOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Notification Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for what you can do.

Deadline.title: Deadline
Deadline.description: Use this option to enable "Deadline" mode. If a device's uptime exceeds the "Deadline" value in days, Renew will enter Aggressive Mode regardless of the remaining deferrals.

SecretQuitKey.title: Secret Quit Key
SecretQuitKey.description: This key in combination with the "Command" key will allow you to quit a dialog window without restarting. Cannot be set to Q! Omit this to leave the default combination (Cmd+])
